data.title: Brit NBA star Ben Gordon arrested - Ex-Chicago Bulls player 'hit son, 10, at airport leaving youngster in hospital'
data.meta_description: FORMER British NBA star Ben Gordon has been arrested after allegedly hitting his son, reports say.The alleged incident unfolded at LaGuardia airport,
data.text:
FORMER British NBA star Ben Gordon has been arrested after allegedly hitting his son, reports say.

The alleged incident unfolded at LaGuardia airport, New York on Monday.

Gordon, from London, was preparing to board a flight to Chicago when he was detained, sources told the New York Post.

The youngster, 10, was taken to the hospital where he was treated for his injuries.

Sources told the New York Daily News that the 39-year-old is expected to be charged with resisting arrest.

Other charges are expected to be filed by authorities.

Two Port Authority cops suffered minor injuries, according to law enforcement sources.

It is the ex-athlete's latest run-in with the law.

In 2017, he was arrested in Los Angeles for pulling several fire alarms, according to USA Today.

In October of that year, Gordon was hospitalized following an altercation involving a woman at a sports rehab facility that he owns in New York, the Chicago Sun-Times reported.

Gordon was found in the bathroom by cops.

The woman, who hasn't been named, claimed that the pair had an argument, alleging that the ex-basketballer was physical.

Gordon was arrested in November 2017 after being accused of punching the manager of an apartment complex where he was renting.

Cops claimed that Gordon pulled a knife on the manager.

And, he was arrested in Manhattan after being caught driving with a forged license plate.

In 2020, Gordon discussed his battles with mental health in an essay shared on the Players Tribune website.

Gordon starred for the Chicago Bulls, Detroit Pistons, and Orlando Magic during his NBA career.

He was named the NBA Sixth Man of the Year in 2005 - an award that's handed out to the best substitute player.
